intro: Licania imbaimadaiensis, commonly known as the Amazonian licania, is a flowering plant native to the dense rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its woody structure and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
